qas.question: What is the country's largest university?
In 2007 the University of the Republic had a student body of how many people?
When was the University of the Republic founded?
Who is the current rector of The University of the Republic?

context: <a0_0>The University of the Republic<a0_0/> is the country's largest and most important university, with a student body of <a1_0>81,774<a1_0/>, according to the census of 2007. It was founded on <a2_0>18 July 1849<a2_0/> in Montevideo, where most of its buildings and facilities are still located. Its current Rector is <a3_0>Dr. Rodrigo Arocena<a3_0/>. The university houses 14 faculties (departments) and various institutes and schools. Many eminent Uruguayans have graduated from this university, including Carlos Vaz Ferreira, José Luis Massera, Gabriel Paternain, Mario Wschebor, Roman Fresnedo Siri, Carlos Ott and Eladio Dieste
